result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M Blight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution Total is $772.16 broken down as: $472.21 to Wal-Mart and $299.95 to Target. To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

AS OF 7/17/2014: Restitution on Target is now $839.88 from 14CF480 joint and several  (Wal-mart stays the same) Total Restitution due with Wal-mart is $1,312.09.

AS OF 7/01/2015: Correct Target amount of restitution is the $839.88 ordered on 7/17/2015 but the previous amount of $295.95 should of been included. Total for Target is $1,135.83.

Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

No alcohol or drugs.
Follow all rules and recommendations from the Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Not to take up any residence with anyone in Wisconsin until approval from Agent.

Cases 14CM360, 14CM361, 14CM779, 14CM780 and 14CF480 were dismissed and read into: 14CF483.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Chris Bailey in court.   Defendant Nicole M Blight did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion to Amend JOC to reflect restitution and appointment of Atty. Bailey on this matter. Atty. Bailey has been appointed by the PDO on this case. Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $839.88 to Target - J & S on 14CF480.  Court orders JOC be modified to include Restitution of $839.88 to be paid to Target joint and severly in case 14CF480.
From Atty Bailey, requesting to waive the defendant's appearance at the upcoming motion hearing.  The Court has reviewed and granted the request.

Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: July 17, 2014 Motion Hearing.  Defendant no longer in the Waukesha County Jail.
Motion hearing on July 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
To Amend Judgment of Conviction, filed by the State.

Defendant Nicole M Blight in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Mary C Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge in the information. Court sentenced the defendant to the following sentence:  

3 years total lenght of sentence
18 months total confinement
18 months extended supervision
STAYED for 2 years probation concurrent
Conditions of Probation:
Defendant not to consume any alcohol or drugs.
Follow all rules and recommendations from her agent
Provide a DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge as COP
Court Costs of $268.00 as COP
Not to take up any residence with anyone in Wisconsin until approval from her agent
Pay restitution in the amount of $472.21 to Wal Mart and $299.95 to Target. 
If revoked, 22 days credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 21, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Nicole M Blight in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail motion deferred to Br. 9  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Attorney Bailey
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicole M Blight in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey as friend of the court.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
